awesomely gorgeous game

If you like the movie Inception and rever the mindfuck it gave then definitely get the game. Gorgeous and vivid in a nostalgic american kind of way. Harkens back to the honky tonk and gilded age of America with a twist. Loved the combat and it isn't all just eye candy but  filled with historical allusions. The intearactables in the game probaby had its counterparts in real life back in the early 1900s. One annoying detraction was the save system...wth were they thinking! Besides that minor annoyance the game is a sterling example of immersion and storytelling. Hint: Watch through the credits for a nice treat! Just like how Disney/Pixar does to their feature films...its not exactly an easter egg but Hallelujah!
You must play this game!

Gráficos, sons, ambientação, cenário e histórias muito bem trabalhados e sem sombra de dúvida uma das Inteligências Artificiais mais legal que eu joguei em conjunto, é divertido parar as vezes e olhar a Elizabeth reagindo aos cenários e acontecimentos, ate mesmo a interação direta com o personagem principal, criando uma espécia de responsabilidade de zelar pela sobrevivência dela. A historia é ótima pois o final realmente não é esperado, para quem gosta de um bom single-player com ótima história esse jogo é o indicado.

Great game to play with a controller.  Storyline has me hooked for sure!

If you haven't played Bioshock Infinite you really must. It's an outstanding game that really proves that games can have superb narratives. It's story is by far it's strongest aspect, provoking many thoughts through it's many themes. Gameplay is still that same fun that it was in the original Bioshock being a mix of a FPS with a few RPG elements. The music and sound design really add to the depth of immersion you get from the game, no CGI cutscenes and very few in game ones, the game makes a good effort of presenting and thoroughly interesting world. 
The only problem with the game for the majority of people will be the ending, while in my opinion being one the best endings to a game i have ever seen, it is very devisive due to the way it ends. Never the less i still recommend playing Bioshock Infinite, even if you haven't played the first it really is worth playing just for the story if for nothing else.

1999 MODE I HATE YOU

BioShock Infinite, um game mais do que ótimo! Uma ambientação incrível, gráficos que não deixam a desejar, um enredo que para mim é uma das melhores histórias em jogos que eu já vi, há tempos não jogava um jogo que a história me cativasse tanto como a deste game. Um FPS digno de ser chamado de FPS, jogabilidade ótima, apesar de ter aqueles inimigos reciclados de sempre... Para mim, se BioShock Infinite não foi o melhor jogo de 2013, está ao menos no Top 5 do ano. Não tem muito o que dizer, mas tenha certeza de que este grande título terá de constar em sua biblioteca, assim como os outros dois títulos da série.
Se eu precisasse dar uma nota para este game, certamente seria 10!

WOOOOOOOOW, this game is the strongest of the three BioShock games. It got awsome graphic, TOTALLY FREAKING AWSOME MIND-BLOWING STORY EVER and a nice put of new stuff. Tho i must i admit i missed some of the stuff that were in the first and second BioShock games, it was new controls with not so many features and a changed in consols, which was a bit annoying. Tho i did manage to change the controls and most stuff through the setting but still i felt alot of stuff were missing, like quicksave for example.
[spoiler] I also didn't find a connection to the first until the epic ending where everything adds up but still blows your mind away. I haven't played the dlcs yet so i can't say i know the whole story or how it continues but i look forward for more!	 [/spoiler]
But it was a really fun, mind-blowing and awsome game in any other way. 10/10!! :D

Только что прошел до конца эту игру. Я считаю, что это одна из лучших компьютерных игр когда либо созданных. Звучит пафосно, но так оно и есть. Игра довольно длинная, но скучать здесь не придется, действие не утихает ни на минуту. Сюжет настолько запутан, что разобраться во всем можно лишь пройдя игру до самого-самого конца. Любители психологических фильмов вроде "Острова проклятых", "Начала" и прочих будут крайне довольны. Настоятельно рекомендую эту шедевральную игру к прохождению.

A good story driven by the relationship between the player character and your companion, a young, immensly powerful woman with reality-altering abilities.

This is first and foremost a first-person shooter with RPG leveling elements, that can be payed in an alternate "story mode" which removes the challenge in favour of a 4-6 hour story-focused experience.

The AI companion is brilliant, locations are very well designed, and even though the grand setting is beyond implausable, it fits well with other thematic elements that are revealed later.

A very high-quality game and an excellent singleplayer experience.

Great story, amazing setting, engrossing atmosphere, lovable characters, and fantastic set pieces caked in layers of boring gunplay, a progressively more esoteric/convoluted plot, and what is easily one of the biggest letdown endings you can find (a slideshow would've been better).

If you like well-written characters, well-planned plots, intricate story arcs, or just a story that makes sense, turn away and never look back.  These amazing visuals, the decent gameplay and the wonderful architecture can't make up for the painfully bad character writing.  If you really need to play this game, change all of the audio to a language you can't understand and don't put on any subtitles.  You might stumble a little bit, but this isn't a genius' mastermind, you don't really need words to get through the game.  In fact, they generally get in the way of the game.

Overall, the game deserves an 7/10.
The game seems to have very little to tie in to the sick and twisted city of Rapture we've all come to know and love. The only sort of tie-in has to be bought for $30, forcing any player to have to pay at  least $35 to get the full experience (not including the other dlc only including the Burial at Sea episodes). Anyways, the tears and such are great and fabulous yaddayadda but it's all very open. Basically the series goes from tight spaces, nooks, and crannies, to open, fresh air and not a drop of water that could come crashing through glass at any second. I get it's supposed to be a prequel but come on, it has very little to do with the first 2 games. No tight spaces, no freakishly weird maniacs to fight. The game's new functions are fun and helpful, but it still has nothing brought from the first and second except maybe a few select mechanics. The grabber/melee weapon (whatever you want to call it) helps a bit in battle but soon after beginning the game, that thing basically becomes useless as a melee weapon. Being forced to beat some guy with that thing 7-15 times is just boring and wastes time. The game was overall loads of fun, and the storyline didn't seem to have any sort of inconsistensies, probably because of the fact that you entered a tear every few hours of gameplay. Anyways, the story is very well made, however the ending is very rushed, it's almost like you're forced to try and understand 32 things at once. The ending only really makes sense after thinking about it quite a bit. Also, there are no choices to make, the game is extremely linear. The game really falls through with all the lovable things about the other 2 Bioshock games, basically throwing the mechanics and storyline from those 2 out of a window and into a dumpster. If the 2 Burial at Sea episodes weren't so dam expensive I wouldn't even be talking about this right now. Overall: 7/10 due to the lack of anything Bioshock, Bioshock 2, and Rapture.
